name: ischemic stroke
description: CT: initially normal, later hypodense. MRI: T1 hypointense, T2 hyperintense. Blockage of blood flow to brain tissue.

name: hemorrhagic stroke
description: CT: hyperdense. MRI: T1 hyperintense, T2 hypointense. Rupture of blood vessel in the brain.

name: stroke (unspecified)
description: Select if the specific type of stroke is not known or inferred from imaging.

name: multiple sclerosis
description: MRI: T2 and FLAIR hyperintense, T1 hypointense in chronic lesions. Demyelinating disease causing scar tissue.

name: tumor
description: MRI: T2 hyperintense, T1 hypointense. Abnormal cell growth in the brain.

name: surgical lesion
description: Post-surgical cavity or enhancement on imaging. e.g., ablation, ultrasound.

name: encephalitis
description: Inflammation of the brain, often due to infection.

name: vascular malformations
description: Abnormal connection between blood vessels, can cause lesions through calcification or hemorrhage.

name: unspecified
description: Report did not specify, or this data was not collected during annotation.
